intro: Drepananthus novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea hookweed, is a member of the Commelinaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including New Guinea. The plant features slender, creeping stems that often form dense mats on the ground. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It is adapted to moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks.
